8_16w7UuJAHbt8YBa8zxHS7UFk9mq8Q5DpE4.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_32_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): As @koure mentioned, it's because the seed is almost always a webseed. Like dropbox, peerify, or a personal seedbox. It's the easiest way to get a video up 24/7 without having to seed yourself. As for why there aren't more, it's because no one else seeds the videos. It's an ongoing problem with webtorrent, namely due to performance issues with webrtc.

I doubt it has anything to do with the performance of WebRTC and WebTorrent. It's just that not a lot of people are aware that this software exists.. including ZeroNet. Publicity is what we need more than anything .. the code will write itself. ;)

> [kaffie](#comment_35_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): I know that people who normally seed tons of torrents are staying away because it's currently impossible with the current clients (your computer crawls to a halt after enough torrents are added).

Now that you remind me, yes.. that is still a problem.

WebTorrent.Desktop hasn't been updated for nearly a year now, and probably won't be for quite some time. Then again, i'm thinking of taking over the project.. they're not teaching us anything new in college right now, besides how the Internet works.. but I'm already getting the hang of NodeJS. 

Speaking of college - don't ever go to college, unless you absolutely have to. I've learned more from Stackoverflow than I ever will at school.. ;)

> [kaffie](#comment_36_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Yeah I learned that the hard way as well. College was pretty useless. At least it'll make it easier to immigrate.

Well. I just finished working on a Peerify alternative...
Upload size limit: 50mb. Enjoy! ;)
http://www.kittyseedbox.tk:3000

11_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh.body:
KopyKate is now mobile friendly, too.. at least on Android phones.
Try visiting the ZeroProxy at http://www.kittyseedbox.tk:43110/kopykate.bit using any smartphone with Android OS (won't work on anything made by Apple, because Apple hasn't implemented full WebRTC support yet). Feedback is appreciated!

You can use both Firefox and Chrome. Chrome seems to work faster.
 
My alcatel Pixi phone views the site perfeclty, but videos are kinda slow. A Samsung Galaxy S7, on the other hand, would play 480p and 720p videos pretty smoothly.

8_16UYTd5pL9rt4hhxQAmfX89QqmjJB58xDx.body: Sorry for the lack of English - but German comedy only works in German. ;)

Laughed so hard, I cried. Considering how depressing world politics has gotten - this piece of satire is a much needed breath of intellectual fresh air, without resorting to cringy, campy stereotypes of Hitler parodies.

That blonde lady with the e-cigarette is fucken Hot. 
I said it..
Best line ever: You call me a monster? Who is the monster. The people who elected me? Do you want to outlaw democracy? You cannot kill me. I am a part of you.

9_16UYTd5pL9rt4hhxQAmfX89QqmjJB58xDx.body:
Netflix has some really good stuff this year. This could signal the end of Hollywood.

KopyKate of course does not intend to compete with Netflix. Think of Netflix as a giant seedbox that has only the best HD movies being streamed from high-speed data centers. The average person would happily pay for that service than figure out how to install uTorrent. (There's enough newbies here on ZeroNet who don't even understand how torrenting works!)

Moral of the story - Piracy is good for the entertainment industry. In fact, we are doing them a favour by providing free marketing. It's easier to subscribe to Netflix than it is to download torrents. However, torrents will always remain an alternative for broke college students, the poor ... or just anyone who doesn't want to miss out on world culture due to economic barriers, geographical barriers, political barriers, etc.

13_16UYTd5pL9rt4hhxQAmfX89QqmjJB58xDx.body: Seriously tho .. why the fuck would you go to another planet without wearing a space suit, even if it had breathable air? Ever heard of interplanetary contamination????

14_16UYTd5pL9rt4hhxQAmfX89QqmjJB58xDx.body:
Vuze seems promising as a Torrent client. It has BitTorrent and WebTorrent support. It doesn't use up anywhere near as much GPU as WebTorrent.Desktop does, but it does seem a tad little slower in terms of upload speed (which is understandable, but that would be fixed if at least 2 people were seeding the torrent!)

I'm going to try and play Dota 2 now and watch videos on KopyKate using my smartphone, while seeding with Vuze. See if seeding impacts the performance.

15_16UYTd5pL9rt4hhxQAmfX89QqmjJB58xDx.body:
I've just created a tracker for KopyKate. Make sure you refresh the page to get the new WebTorrent.js version. Vuze is pretty amazing - it lets you create your own WebTorrent trackers, to speed up peer discovery! Will post some tutorials soon..

Please use VUZE, not WebTorrent.Desktop for mass-seeding!
It seems to work great one moment, and then next moment it's down. It's all to do with peer discovery. I'll leave my Vuze torrent client on anyway, it's not taking up CPU.

The torrent only seems to work when there are peers showing up as Online on this table:

https://www.kittyseedbox.tk/img/Screenshot%20from%202017-08-27%2010-05-36.png

Really, the key to solving this puzzle is to understand the whole algorithm. Once you get the logic right, the code just writes itself.

12_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_42_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): This video is uploaded on peerify, because kittify seems to have broken for new uploads. Here's the kittify link: https://www.kittyseedbox.tk/kittify/uploads/Dead Drop 17 Secure Enclave Key Defcon Vids CAN Vulnerability Smart Lock Fail.mp4.torrent

Ah. It's just too many spaces in the file name.

> [kaffie](#comment_43_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Is there a limit or something? Or is it just the parsing that's weird? On the backend it should just auto-convert to %20 and call it a day. There's another video uploaded that's broken due to it as well.

Is that the Nintendo one?

Hmm.. yeah, it just doesn't like overly-complex file names for some reason. I have yet to figure out the pattern.. should be an easy fix anyway.

> [kaffie](#comment_44_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Yeah, the nintendo video. And I agree on the overly-complex file names. I was just lazy and assumed it'd work. Regardless it's still a bug.

Interestingly, it didn't trip the Japanese-character one you uploaded. I got it working by getting rid of the word CAN. With the other one, I got it working by getting rid of the hash symbol and exclamation marks.
